reviewText: I have all the bellytwins videos, from the workout to the dance tapes. I'm someone who hates aerobics, yet learning bellydance moves seems somehow natural, and it offers a bit of a challenge and a lot of fun. The dance videos are quite manageable, though some of the steps take work, but it wouldn't be fun if you learned everything right away. The beauty is in the process of learning an art form. Plus since dancing and working out to these tapes I feel great. More energy and the neck and back soreness I would wake up to a couple days a week virtually went away. I also am getting more flexible. The production quality on the twins' tapes is excellent and they dress in such a way that doesn't hinder your ability to watch and follow their moves. The workout videos don't always explain everything quite as well, but the more you do them the easier it gets. Sort of that little light bulb going off, 'Hey I can do that now where I couldn't at first' sort of thing. If I feel kind of drained and crabby I find dancing to one of the tapes works a thousand times better than a cup of coffee or a nap.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I did the Basic Dance tape about 7-8 times, and then went for the Beyond Basic Dance tape. Wow. :) I've done this one 3 times now, and am slowly getting the hang of it (managed to do the three quarter shimmy for the first time today!)It is a lot of fun, and a good workout at the same time. I'm seeing new definition in my abs and hip muscles (and I've been weight training for ages!) Give it a try - Neena and Veena are very nice and friendly, without being sickening. :)
Title: N/A

reviewText: The video is gorgeous to look at, and it starts out well with some good stretches.  The moves they introduce in order for you to be able to put it all together for the choreography are for the most part buiding on what a beginner would do, but with more movement across or around the floor.I have been dancing since November, and am still trying to master some of the moves which they show on this video--and my teacher considers me an excellent student.  The three quarter shimmy traveling is a killer.Some of the camera work focuses only on their lovely faces, so it is hard to see what the hips are supposed to be doing. And sometimes they spend so much time on a really simple move like a hip bump, when they could be spending more time breaking down some of the more difficult moves.But on the whole it is invaluable for practicing at home-no matter how many times you go to class it is good to practice on your own.  Fun and a good workout, and the music is excellent, the costumes lovely.
summary: Very clear, a bit basic in some places, hard in others

Title: N/A

reviewText: I have purchased a number of bellydance videos by different instructors and so far I like the best Veena's and Neena's instructional videos for bellydancing.Even if you've never bellydanced before, Veena and Neena guide you step by step, from the beginning, first guiding you through the elements of the dance separately and then you get to practice along and do the entire sequence.At the beginning of the tape, you get to admire one dance by Veena and Neena, followed by a warm up and then onto the most fun part - the dance itself.  Everything is thoroughly explained and demonstrated and you can rest assured that you will be able to do the moves.  Some are easier to execute than others, but with practice, you're bound to improve and you'll have fun all along.
summary: My favorite series of bellydance instructional videos
Title: N/A

reviewText: I found this to be pretty shallow and rather boring. If you have taken beginning bellydance classes or have done a few beginner DVD's then you won't learn anything new or interesting.  It also seems dated to me. The coreo at the end was very ho hum and I wouldn't want to wach a dancer perform it. However, if you are new to bellydance (or want to say, teach a younger girl how to bellydance) then this might be appropriate. It's not hard to follow along because the instruction is clear, and it's very mild in the cardio department.If you are a beginner I highly suggest buying something in the "Lucious" series instead because they are much more fun. There are a ton of beginner DVD's out there but I don't recommend adding this one to your collection.

reviewText: I love these DVDs..  they give great detailed instruction and go at a great pace.  If they make new bellydance instructional DVDs that are even more advanced I am ready to buy them  :D  As for the reviewer who said the dance at the end is too hard... well, personally if I was able to do the whole routine the first or second time I tried it, I would become boring.  I got the hang of the dance over time and it is very fun  :D

reviewText: This is one of my first DVDs on bellydancing & what got me into it 2 years ago. Great instruction & fun, but the pace could be better. Neena & Veena are my favorite bellydancer instructors. Neena & Veena are my favorite bellydancer instructors. I started & liked their aerobics DVDs "Bellydance Fitness for Beginners" first. They still have the best humor in the voice overs, most relaxed & playful then all the other instructors out there. This is what really makes you want to dance & have fun. Dolphina the Goddess Workouts are good too, but Rania is way too stiff/robotic.The pace is a bit slow, but they are good at putting an interesting & challenging but not too hard routine together. In this DVD, there's a hip move that looks & is slightly complicated that Rania taught in the one Hip Hop workout I have of hers & took me MANY times of rewinding to get it & was the only reason I would use it. In this DVD Neena & Veena taught it so well, I got it the first time!  GOODBYE Rania!You can see previews of this dvd & their other ones atcollagevideo comyoutube com under the titles of their dvds, "belly dance twins" or "Neena & Veena"
